item.title: Nietzsches Butterfly: An Introduction to Chaos Theory and Chaos Engineering
item.description: Chaos theory was immortalized in fiction by “The Sound of Thunder,” a short story that tells the tale of a contemporary presidential election being affected significantly by the death of a pre-historic butterfly. The chain of coincidences that led to this altered future seemed to be random and unpredictable, but when all the changes are tracked-a gargantuan, realistically impossible undertaking-order does emerge. The problem is, you have to accept the idea of chaos trumping simple cause and effect first, before you can see the inherent order at all.
